BiblioData.Title: PROCESS FOR MANUFACTURE OF SILVER- BASED PARTICLES AND ELECTRICAL CONTACT MATERIALS
BiblioData.Abstract: The invention is directed to a process for manufacture of fine precious metal containing particles, specifically silver-based particles and silver-based contact materials via an intermediate silver(+l)-oxide species. The process comprises in a first step the formation of a thermally instable silver (+l)-oxide species by adding a base to an aqueous silver salt solution comprising an organic dispersing agent. Due to the presence of the organic dispersing agent, the resulting silver (+l)-oxide species is thermally instable, thus the species is decomposing to metallic silver at temperature lower than 1000 DEG C. The process optionally may comprise the addition of a powdered compound selected from the group of inorganic oxides, metals, and carbon-based compounds. Furthermore the process may contain additional separating and drying steps.; The process is versatile, cost efficient and environmentally friendly and is used for the manufacture of silver-based particles and electrical contact materials. Silver nanoparticles made according to the process are characterized by a narrow particle size distribution. Electrical contact materials manufactured according to the process reveal improved contact welding properties.

2. The silver(+l)-oxide species according to claim 1, wherein said species comprises hydroxy- (OH), oxy- (O), hydrocarboxy- (HCO3) or carboxy- (CO3) groups and mixtures or combinations thereof.

3. The silver(+l)-oxide species according to claim 1 or 2, wherein said species further comprises precious metals species selected from the group consisting of gold (Au), platinum (Pt), rhodium (Rh), palladium (Pd) and mixtures or alloys thereof, up to an amount of 20 wt.-% based on the total weight of said species.

4. A process for manufacture of the thermally instable silver(+l)-oxide species defined in any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein a base is reacted with a silver(+l) salt solution in the presence of an organic dispersing agent.
5. The process according to claim 4, further comprising the separation of the silver(+l)- oxide species after the reaction and an optional drying step.

8. The process according to claim 4, wherein the organic dispersing agent is a polar organic ketone solvent.
9. The process according to claim 4, wherein the organic dispersing agent is a polysac- charide.
